members.name: actions
members.description: List of buttons to include in Action Menu.

members.name: href
members.description: If an `href` property is provided, button will be rendered using an `<a>` anchor tag.

members.name: rel
members.description: Relationship of the link

members.name: target
members.description:
Determines where to display the linked URL, options correspond to HTML Anchor `target` attribute.
Only applies if the button is an anchor link.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target

members.name: ariaLabel
members.description: Screen-reader accessible label to read out.

members.name: color
members.description: The color of the button

members.name: size
members.description: The overall size of the Button.

members.name: minimal
members.description: Renders the button without initial background color or border.

members.name: isSecondary
members.description: Renders the button using a secondory, and usually less visually prominent, Button CSS stylesheet.

members.name: buttonType
members.description:
The type of button to render, options correspond to HTML Button `type` attribute.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/button
Only applies if the button is not an anchor link.

members.name: disabled
members.description:
If true, prevents the user from interacting with the button.
Note: Not all browser prevent the click handler from firing on disabled buttons.

members.name: icon
members.description: Name of the icon to render inside the button

members.name: iconOnly
members.description:
If true, removes extra padding from Icon inside the button
TODO: See if we can automatically infer removal of padding through CSS

members.name: isLoading
members.description:
If true, shows a loading spinner icon and sets a `disabled` attribute on the button.
Note: Not all browser prevent the click handler from firing on disabled buttons.

members.name: fill
members.description: If true, the button will take up the full width of the parent container

members.name: tooltip
members.description: An optional help text to display for button focus and hover states.

members.name: dataEl
members.description: An optional data attribute set on the button element for easier targeting using JavaScript.

slots.description: The source code of the `CodeChunk`. Corresponds to the `text` field in the Stencila `CodeChunk` Schema.
slots.name: text

slots.description: `label` element label of the `CodeChunk`. Corresponds to the `label` field in the Stencila `CodeChunk` Schema.
slots.name: label

slots.description: `figcaption` content of the `CodeChunk`. Corresponds to the `caption` field in the Stencila `CodeChunk` Schema.
slots.name: caption

members.name: text
members.description:
Source code contents of the CodeChunk.
Corresponds to the `text` property of the CodeBlock schema.

members.name: autofocus
members.description: Autofocus the editor on page load

members.name: lineWrapping
members.description: Control line wrapping of text inside the editor

members.name: lineNumbers
members.description: Determines the visibility of line numbers

members.name: foldGutter
members.description: Enables ability to fold sections of code if the syntax package supports it

members.name: programmingLanguage
members.description: Programming language of the CodeChunk

members.name: readOnly
members.description: Disallow editing of the editor contents when set to `true`

members.name: executableLanguages
members.description: List of programming languages that can be executed in the current context

members.name: keymap
members.description: Custom keyboard shortcuts to pass along to CodeMirror

members.name: contentChangeHandler
members.description: Callback function to invoke whenever the editor contents are updated.

members.name: handleLanguageChange
members.description:
Listen for the `stencila-language-change` event emitted by the language dropdown
provided by the child Editor component, and update the active language if necessary.

members.name: getContents
members.description: Returns the `CodeChunk` node with the updated `text` content from the editor.

members.name: getTextContents
members.description: Returns the text contents from the editor

members.name: getRef
members.description:
Retrieve a reference to the internal CodeMirror editor.
Allows for maintaining state from applications making use of this component.

slots.description: The source code of the `CodeChunk`. Corresponds to the `text` field in the Stencila `CodeChunk` Schema.
slots.name: text

slots.description: The resulting output when evaluating the CodeChunk. Corresponds to the `outputs` field in the Stencila `CodeChunk` Schema.
slots.name: outputs

slots.description: List of any errors encountered when compiling (e.g. syntax errors) or executing the CodeChunk.
slots.name: errors

slots.description: `label` element label of the `CodeChunk`. Corresponds to the `label` field in the Stencila `CodeChunk` Schema.
slots.name: label

slots.description: `figcaption` content of the `CodeChunk`. Corresponds to the `caption` field in the Stencila `CodeChunk` Schema.
slots.name: caption

members.name: text
members.description:
Source code contents of the CodeChunk.
Corresponds to the `text` property of the CodeChunk schema.

members.name: autofocus
members.description: Autofocus the editor on page load

members.name: programmingLanguage
members.description: Programming language of the CodeChunk

members.name: languageCapabilities
members.description: List of all supported programming languages

members.name: executableLanguages
members.description: List of programming languages that can be executed in the current context

members.name: isCodeVisible
members.description: Whether the code section is visible or not

members.name: executeHandler
members.description: A callback function to be called with the value of the `CodeChunk` node when executing the `CodeChunk`.

members.name: contentChangeHandler
members.description: Callback function to invoke whenever the editor contents are updated.

members.name: executeStatus
members.description: The execution status of the code node

members.name: compileDigest
members.description:
A digest representing the state of a [`Resource`] and its dependencies at
compile time.

members.name: executeRequired
members.description:
Status of upstream dependencies, and whether the node needs to be
re-executed

members.name: executeDigest
members.description:
A digest representing the state of a [`Resource`] and its dependencies from
the latest execution.

members.name: executeEnded
members.description: Time when the latest code execution ended

members.name: executeDuration
members.description: Duration of the latest code execition

members.name: keymap
members.description: Custom keyboard shortcuts to pass along to CodeMirror

members.name: onAllCodeVisibilityChange
members.description: A global event listener to show/hide code in this component

members.name: toggleCodeVisibility
members.description: Toggle code visibility, either locally, or globally

members.name: checkIfExecutable
members.description:
Determine if the CodeChunk can be executed or not.
For a CodeChunk to be considered executable it must have a `executeHandler` function attached
and the current `programmingLanguage` must be in the list of `executableLanguages`.

members.name: handleLanguageChange
members.description:
Listen for the `stencila-language-change` event emitted by the language dropdown
provided by the child Editor component, and update the active language if necessary.

members.name: getContents
members.description: Returns the `CodeChunk` node with the updated `text` content from the editor.

members.name: getTextContents
members.description: Returns the text contents from the editor

members.name: execute
members.description: Run the `CodeChunk`

members.name: getRef
members.description:
Retrieve a reference to the internal CodeMirror editor.
Allows for maintaining state from applications making use of this component.

events.name: stencila-code-execute
events.description: Emitted to indicate that code node should be executed

events.name: stencila-code-execute-cancel
events.description: Emitted to indicate that the execution of the code node should be cancelled/interrupted.

events.name: stencila-code-visibility-change
events.description: A global event emitter to show/hide code in all `CodeChunk` or `CodeExpression` components

events.name: stencila-editor-layout-change
events.description:
Trigger a global DOM event to set the layout of all `CodeChunk` component.
Can be set to either show the editor and outputs side by side or stacked vertically.

members.name: nodeId
members.description: The Node ID, should match the HTML `id` attribute.

members.name: label
members.description: User assigned label for the node

members.name: nodeKind
members.description:
Node kind, such as `CodeChunk`, `CodeExpression`, `Parameter`, etc.
Aligns with the Stencila Schema node types.

members.name: executeAuto
members.description:
Whether the dependency should be automatically re-executed based on semantic
analysis of the code.

members.name: executeRequired
members.description:
Status of upstream dependencies, and whether the node needs to be
re-executed

members.name: executeStatus
members.description: The execution status of the code node

members.name: programmingLanguage
members.description:
Programming language of the CodeExpression, note that not all nodes have this
property (`Parameter` for example).

Function to call when the user selects a new language from the language
picker dropdown.

editor.

Determine if the CodeChunk can be executed or not.

and the current `programmingLanguage` must be in the list of `executableLanguages`.

members.description:
The context of the component. In `read` mode the code content and its
language cannot be edited.

members.description: List of all supported programming languages

events.name: stencila-language-change
events.description: Event emitted when the language of the editor is changed.

events.description: Event emitted when the source code of the `CodeExpression` node is changed.

slots.description: The table element to render. Expects a fully formed and valid HTML `table` tag.
slots.name: default

members.name: open
members.description: Determines whether the contents are visible or not.

members.name: sourceUrl
members.description: The URL of the document being decorated. Could be a Snapshot from Stencila Hub, a Project URL, or something else.

members.name: position
members.description:
When `fixed` the Navbar will remain pinned to the top of the screen.
Note that if the Navbar component is not followed by a sibling element,
you will have to set `margin-top: 3rem` on the following element yourself.

members.name: executeStatus
members.description: The execution status of the document

events.name: stencila-code-execute
events.description: Emitted to indicate that code node should be executed

events.name: stencila-kernel-restart
events.description: Emitted to indicate that language kernels should be restarted

events.name: stencila-code-execute-cancel
events.description: Emitted to indicate that the execution of the code node should be cancelled/interrupted.

slots.description: List of any `stencila-code-error` elements to render in the Errors panel.
slots.name: errors

members.name: contents
members.description: Text contents of the editor

members.name: languageCapabilities
members.description: List of all supported programming languages

members.name: executableLanguages
members.description: List of programming languages that can be executed in the current context

members.name: readOnly
members.description: Disallow editing of the editor contents when set to `true`

members.name: readOnlyChanged
members.description: Update the CodeMirror internal state when the `readOnly` prop changes

members.name: activeLanguage
members.description: Programming language of the Editor

members.name: setEditorSyntax
members.description: Resolve and set a new active CodeMirror syntax

members.name: onSelectLanguage
members.description: Function to call when the user selects a new language from the language picker dropdown.

members.name: activeLanguageChanged
members.description:
Update the internal state, for both the component and CodeMirror, when the
`activeLanguage` prop changes

members.name: executeHandler
members.description: Function to be evaluated over the contents of the editor.

members.name: execute
members.description: Wrapper around the `executeHandler` function, needed to run using CodeMirror keyboard shortcuts.

members.name: contentChangeHandler
members.description: Callback function to invoke whenever the editor contents are updated.

members.name: autofocus
members.description: Autofocus the editor on page load

members.name: lineNumbers
members.description: Determines the visibility of line numbers

members.name: lineWrapping
members.description: Control line wrapping of text inside the editor

members.name: foldGutter
members.description: Enables ability to fold sections of code if the syntax package supports it

members.name: keymap
members.description: Custom keyboard shortcuts to pass along to CodeMirror

members.name: getContents
members.description: Retrieve the Editor contents and active language.

members.name: setContents
members.description: Replace the contents of the Editor with a supplied string.

members.name: textSlotObserver
getState
members.description: Retrieve a JSON representation of the the internal editor state.

members.name: setState
members.description: Update the internal editor state with the given JSON object.

members.name: setStateFromString
members.description:
Create a new editor state from a given string.
The string will be used as the initial contents of the editor.

members.name: getRef
members.description:
Retrieve a reference to the internal CodeMirror editor.
Allows for maintaining state from applications making use of this component.

members.name: stopEventPropagation
members.description:
Prevents keyboard event listeners attached to parent DOM elements from firing.
This is to avoid conflicts when user has focused on the editor.

members.name: focus
members.description: Brings DOM focus to the editor

events.name: stencila-language-change
events.description: Event emitted when the language of the editor is changed.

events.name: stencila-content-change
events.description: Event emitted when the content of the editor is changed.

members.name: error
members.description: The `CodeError` node

members.name: level
members.description: The severity of the error message

members.name: updateLevel
members.description:
Update the level, if not defined, based on the content of the `type` slot

In the future, `CodeError` is likely to be replace with `CodeNotification` (or similar)
and `level` will be a property (so it does not need to be derived here)

members.name: hasStackTrace
members.description: Flag for whether there is a stack trace

members.name: updateHasStackTrace
members.description: Determine if the `stacktrace` slot has content

members.name: stackTraceIsOpen
members.description: Toggle for visibility of the stack trace

members.name: icon
members.description:
Name of the icon to be rendered.
Corresponds to icon names from the [Remix Icon set](http://remixicon.com)

members.name: iconStyle
members.description: Style with which to render the icon

members.name: color
members.description: The fill color of the icon

members.name: iconUrl
members.description: The URL of the SVG file containing icon symbols

members.name: image
members.description: The `ImageObject` node to render

declarations.name: preferredImageObjectComponent

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The image to return a component for

declarations.description:
Return the preferred component for an `ImageObject`.

Looks in the `content` property of the image (if any) and returns
a component for the first recognized node in that array. Similar
in behaviour to the HTML `<picture>` element.

members.name: autoFocus
members.description: Automatically bring cursor focus to the input field on render.

members.name: inputmode
members.description: A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.

members.name: type
members.description: Type of input field.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the input, submitted as the value's label inside the form data.

members.name: label
members.description: Accessible text label for the input field. Defaults to the input's `name` prop.

members.name: hideLabel
members.description:
Visually conceal the input label.
Use sparingly for simple forms only with a descriptive action button.

members.name: inline
members.description: Render the label and input field as inline elements.

members.name: placeholder
members.description: Short hint demonstrating expected input value. Shown when the input is empty.

members.name: iconStart
members.description: Icon to show at the start of the input field.

members.name: required
members.description: When `true` value must be provided before submitting.

members.name: readOnly
members.description: Indicate that this is a controlled input, preventing user editing of the value

members.name: value
members.description: Text value of the input.

members.name: isOpen
members.description: Determines whether the Menu is shown or not

members.name: autoClose
members.description: Close the menu when losing focus

members.name: autoOpen
members.description: Open the menu on hover or when gaining focus

members.name: menuPosition
members.description: The position relative to the toggle button where the menu should appear.

members.name: icon
members.description: Name of the icon to show before the label

members.name: size
members.description: The overall size of the component.

members.name: role
members.description: The overall size of the component.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Determines whether the menu item is enabled/clickable or not

members.name: divider
members.description:
Renders the menu item as a section divider.
It does not have any click or hover handlers

slots.description: A list or collection of elements to render. If empty, a message stating "No output to show" will be rendered instead.
slots.name: default

slots.description: The current value of the parameter
slots.name: value

members.name: mode
members.description:
The context of the component. In `read` mode the parameter validator and its
properties cannot be edited.

members.name: validator
members.description: The Stencila `Validator` Schema with which to configure and validate the parameter.

events.name: stencila-parameter-change
events.description:
Event emitted when either the name of value of the parameter changes.
You can use the `type` property of the event detail to determine the type
of change, it will be either `value` or `name`.

events.name: stencila-validator-change
events.description:
Event emitted when either the type or property of the parameter validator
changes.
You can use the `type` property of the event detail to determine the type
of change, it will be either `validator` or `property`.

members.name: graph
members.description: The project graph data to render

members.name: href
members.description: The link the tab should navigate to

members.name: label
members.description: The displayed text of the Tab

members.name: isSelected
members.description: Indicates whether the current tab is "selected"

members.name: tabs
members.description: A list of string values to use as tab labels

members.name: dismissable
members.description:
If true, shows a "close" button to immediately dismiss the toast.
Note that this prop has no effect if `duration` is set to zero, in which case
the toast will always show the "close" button.

members.name: duration
members.description:
Duration in milliseconds for how long the toast should be display
Setting `duration` to `0` will disable auto-dismissal of the toast.

members.name: type
members.description: Type of the toast to show. Affects the component colour scheme.

members.name: position
members.description: Where on the screen to show the Toast. Overrides the base position set in the `ToastController` instance.

members.name: position
members.description:
Default position of Toasts on the screen.
Can be overridden by individual Toast instances.

members.name: position
members.description:
When `fixed` the Navbar will remain pinned to the top of the screen.
Note that if the Navbar component is not followed by a sibling element,
you will have to set `margin-top: 3rem` on the following element yourself.

members.name: color
members.description: The background fill color of the Navbar

members.name: text
members.description: The text content of the Tooltip.

members.name: position
members.description: The placement of the tooltip

members.name: data
members.description: The Plotly data to render as an interactive visualization.

members.name: layout
members.description: The Plotly layout settings object

members.name: config
members.description: The Plotly configuration object

members.name: onPlotlyLoad
members.description: When detecting that the Plotly.js has loaded, render the data if it hasnt been rendered already

events.name: stencila-plotly-load
events.description: Custom event emitter to indicate that the loading of the Plotly.js script has finished

members.name: spec
members.description: The Vega or Vega-Lite spec

members.name: options
members.description: A JavaScript object containing options for embedding

members.name: onVegaLoad
members.description: When detecting that the Vega JS has loaded, render the data if it hasnt been rendered already

events.name: stencila-vega-load
events.description: Custom event emitter to indicate that the loading of the Vega JS script has finished
